meanings.definition: A device or piece of equipment used to remove impurities or unwanted elements from a substance.
meanings.sent1: The coffee machine has special filters to keep the grounds out of the brewed coffee.
meanings.sent2: She used filters to clean the water before drinking it.
meanings.sent3: The filters in the fish tank decided to go on strike, leaving the water murky.
meanings.sent4: His mind acted like filters, blocking out negative thoughts and focusing on the positive.
meanings.sent5: The air filters in the car were so clogged that the engine struggled to run smoothly.

meanings.definition: A feature or function in software or an app that allows users to limit or refine the results displayed.
meanings.sent1: The email app has useful filters to organize incoming messages.
meanings.sent2: She applied filters to the photos to make them look more vibrant.
meanings.sent3: The filters in the social media app decided to play a prank by hiding all the posts.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like filters, focusing only on the important information.
meanings.sent5: The search filters on the website made it easy to find exactly what she was looking for.

meanings.definition: A porous material or device used to separate solids from liquids or gases.
meanings.sent1: The coffee filters in the machine prevented the grounds from getting into the cup.
meanings.sent2: He used filters to purify the air in the room.
meanings.sent3: The filters in the experiment decided to take a break, causing a mix-up in the results.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as filters, letting only the truth pass through.
meanings.sent5: The oil filters in the car engine kept the oil clean and free of debris.
